alert.note: Alert for McKinley; Rio Arriba; San Juan; Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued May 08 at 12:26PM MDT until May 08 at 2:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northwestern McKinley County in west central New Mexico... Northwestern Rio Arriba County in north central New Mexico... Northwestern Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... Southeastern San Juan County in northwestern New Mexico... * Until 215 PM MDT. * At 1221 PM MDT, an area of dust was currently stretching from southwest to northeast across much of San Juan county. The dust was originating near Tohatchi and spreading northeastward into Lake Valley and across Blanco Trading Post and Nageezi and moving toward the northeast. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Highway 550 between Mile Markers 101 and 137. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 93 and 127, and between Mile Markers 165 and 169. Highway 491 and New Mexico State route 371. Locations impacted include... Heron Lake State Park, Blanco Trading Post, Nageezi, El Huerfano Trading Post, Chaco Canyon, Lake Valley, Tohatchi and Brimhall Nizhoni. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. Pull your vehicle fully off the side of the road, keep your headlights off, and take your foot off of the brake pedal. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

area.areaDesc: McKinley; Rio Arriba; San Juan; Sandoval
